chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Racine County Alternatives Program
Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims D.L and L.L  (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant O.R. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant must be compliant with all orders of the CHIPS action. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
*Amended 02-17-22* May have contact with victim A.P Pursuant to any family court proceedings, not to discuss any court proceedings with the child.

9:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adeola B Palmer appeared in court, Attorney Eric Steven Maciolek appeared by video for Adeola B Palmer. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
NG plea entered.
State requests bond modification to have absolutely no contact with the child.
Defense requests bond mirror family court proceedings. 
BTC: Bond motion granted to allow contact with the child victim A.P pursuant to family court proceedings, defendant is not to discuss the felony file with victim.  
Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:27 AM Defendant Adeola B Palmer appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Eric Steven Maciolek appeared in court for Adeola B Palmer, Attorney Diane Donohoo appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense intends to file a substitution; asks that ARGN be set over. Bond motion filed as well; defense gives add'l argument. The State does not take a position on bond request and asks for the Court to find the State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State is unsure if HSD is involved. Per Atty Van Schyndel, a CHIPS action is pending, 

BTC: The Court takes judicial notice of 21JC93. Bond may be modified to $5000.00 cash; same terms and conditions as previously ordered; condition to be included that deft must obey all orders of the CHIPS action.
Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adeola B Palmer appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Erin J. Preston appeared by video for Adeola B Palmer. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense contests counts 1 and 2 as to whether great bodily harm occurred.
State asks any motions to dismiss counts 1 and 2 be denied. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss counts 1 and 2 denied.
